alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 28 at 3:26AM PDT until March 29 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches below 6500 feet, with localized amounts of 12 to 18 inches above 8000 feet, are expected. * WHERE...The snow level will rise above 7000 feet in the afternoon, then fall to 5500 feet late tonight. The strongest winds will be near the ridge tops and along the desert slopes through early this evening. * WHEN...11 AM today to 8 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency and carry chains. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
